Description: There is a power cut in the LL20 postcode area of Llangollen, affecting properties in Coed Afon, Regent Street and surrounding streets. We had no advance warning of this and only became aware of it at 2.07PM. Repairs are taking longer than expected because of further investigations required to locate and repair the fault and our team are now working to get your power back on as quickly and as safely as possible by midnight. We will update this message if this information changes. We apologise for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. This message was updated at 8.14PM on 29th April 2021.

There is an unplanned power cut affecting the WA8 postcode area of Widnes, affecting properties in Heathfield Park, Moyles Close and surrounding streets. It will be necessary for our engineers to carry out an emergency shutdown at 8.45PM due to the repairs required to an underground cable fault. Our team will be carrying out repair work safely on the underground cable network and this may affect the supply to your property. We will work to get your power back on as quickly and as safely as possible, and we expect the power to be restored by 11.30PM. We will update this message if this information changes. We apologise for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. This message was updated at 8.54PM on 29th April 2021.

We are carrying out these works to connect a new property to the underground electricity network. This work is following on from a customers request and due to the type of underground electricity cables we need to make the connection to, engineers will need to temporarily switch off your power to ensure they can carry out this work safely. Due to 138 properties being affected our engineers have worked to reduce the time to complete the works as much as possible. If they can restore your power sooner, they will certainly do so. This work will ensure that our electricity network can uphold the electricity usage in your area whilst also reducing the risk of you having an unplanned power cut. This work is taking place at our substation on Lowell Street. The government has given exemptions to certain industries and activities, this outage falls into this category.

Description: Our engineers need to install a new piece of equipment, called a transformer, on the overhead electricity network. This equipment controls and delivers the electricity into your area. These are essential works that will improve the reliability of the electricity network, ensure our network can uphold the amount of electricity in your area and will also reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut which is why it is important to complete this work during the Coronavirus pandemic. This work is taking place at Trikkle Brook Fishery in Paddock Wood. The government has given exemptions to certain industries and activities, this outage falls into this category. We are adhering to government guidelines to keep our customers and colleagues safe. We are sorry for any inconvenience caused by this work and thank you for your patience.

Description: Our engineers are removing a piece of equipment called a transformer from the high voltage overhead electricity network. The reason this is being removed is due to it being redundant and this has the potential risk of leaking oil. With the risk of the transformer leaking oil and causing an environmental hazard, our engineers need to complete this work as soon as possible and this is the reason why this work needs to take place during the coronavirus pandemic. This work is taking place at Hooe Water Works. The government has given exemptions to certain industries and activities, this outage falls into this category. We are adhering to government guidelines to keep our customers and colleagues safe. We are sorry for any inconvenience this may cause and thank you.
